result.execSummary:
The defendant Blair Ashley Adam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Blair Ashley Adam in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Blair Ashley Adam in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Blair Ashley Adam in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
